climbs.name: The Buoyancy Test
climbs.fa: Michael Madsen   Cleaned by: Chuck Fryberger, Michael Madsen, Matt Cochran, Taylor Lais, John Anderson, Monika Pupikova

content.description: Start standing on sharp crimps and a rail feature. Move left along the sharp crystal rail feature and transition to the arête. Move up on the left arête to the slab top out.
content.protection: crash pads and spotters are a must for this!
content.location: Problem faces down hill South facing.

content.description: The Egg is a beautiful tall test piece. This boulder was first cleaned and kept " secret" it was first envisioned by Colorado climber Chuck Fryberger. It wasn't until a few years ago a group of climbers really put some effort into it. The bottom is sharp and that's what kept it elusive. The crimps are good at the bottom. Matt Cochran and Taylor Lais almost had this thing sent a few years back but lack of pads and spotters kept it unclimbed. It resparked interest but would take another 2 years to finally get it finished up. Crux is the first couple of moves and then transitioning onto the arête. Once you are able to stand up on the arête it should be cake walk to the top. This is a highball boulder. You will need more than one crash pad to feel safe. Spotter is a huge plus. This problem will be in line with Acid Test for test pieces of Sylvan Lake. Beautiful Line.
